CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 6, 1940, pg. 12 reads: " Bill Robinson, Actor And Ambassador Of Goodwill, Spends A Busy Week In Smoketown - When the "Hot Mikado" Bill "Bojangles" Robinson came to town, Pittsburgh received him as a superb dancer, an unsurpassed entertainer, a 61-year-old- man who has brought joyful tears to the eyes of millions of people. But Pittsburgh got more than the dancer, the entertainer and the comedian.  Shown here are some pictures of Bo as he identified himself with the civic and social life of the city, a veritable goodwill ambassador..." Cutline from related article published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 23, 1939, pg. 20 " Hollywood Make-Up Men Coming To Pittsburgh - The Hollywood Make-Up Men who have taken the Detroit women by storm since September 27 will pack their bags on December 30 and will leave for Pittsburgh..." Cutline from related article published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 3, 1940, pg. 9 reads: "Hollywood Make-Up Artists On Way To Birmingham, Ala. BIRMINGHAM, Ala., Feb. 1 - The Hollywood Make-Up Artists headed by Harry L. Warner, are on their way to Alabama's City of Steel...fresh from a great beauty campaign in North's City of Steel (Pittsburgh)..."  Cutline from related article published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 13, 1940, pg. 20 "Southernaires Entertain Harry L. Warner - The Southernaires, of radio fame, entertained Harry L. Warner, Hollywood make-up man..."
TitMainTitle: Thirteen women and "Hollywood Make-Up Man" Harry L. Warner, posed on stage with backdrop of theatrical scene from "The Hot Mikado," Nixon Theater
